```{r setup, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE}
options(htmltools.dir.version = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(comment = "")

library(tidyverse)
library(cowplot)
library(patchwork)
library(here)

# ggplot2 settings so plots scale well for slide size 
theme_set(theme_gray(16)) # 16 for full width, 18 for half width 
update_geom_defaults("point", list(size = 2.0)) # 2 for full width, 2.5 for half width
```

## Compound figures

Two common scenarios:

--

1\. The same type of plot is replicated many times (small multiples)

--

2\. Several disparate plots are combined into one display

## Distinguish infographics from figures in article/book

There are two distinct use cases:

--

**Infographic:** Standalone, has title/subtitle/caption

--

**Figure in article/book:** Caption contains title, not part of figure

---

## Making compound plots in R


---

## The **patchwork** package

.tiny-font.pull-left.width-40[
```{r patchwork-demo1, eval = FALSE}
library(patchwork)

# make first plot
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(mpg, disp))

p1
```
]

.pull-right.width-55[
```{r patchwork-demo1-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label="patchwork-demo1", fig.width=6., fig.asp = 0.75, echo=FALSE, dev = "svg"}
```
]

---

## The **patchwork** package

.tiny-font.pull-left.width-40[
```{r patchwork-demo2, eval = FALSE}
library(patchwork)

# make first plot
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(mpg, disp))

# make second plot
p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  aes(gear, disp, group = gear) +
  geom_boxplot()

p2
```
]

.pull-right.width-55[
```{r patchwork-demo2-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label="patchwork-demo2", fig.width=6., fig.asp = 0.75, echo=FALSE, dev = "svg"}
```
]

---

## The **patchwork** package

.tiny-font.pull-left.width-40[
```{r patchwork-demo3, eval = FALSE}
library(patchwork)

# make first plot
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(mpg, disp))

# make second plot
p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  aes(gear, disp, group = gear) +
  geom_boxplot()

# place plots side-by-side #<<
p1 | p2   #<<
```
]

.pull-right.width-55[
```{r patchwork-demo3-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label="patchwork-demo3", fig.width=6., fig.asp = 0.5, echo=FALSE, dev = "svg"}
```
]

---

## The **patchwork** package

.tiny-font.pull-left.width-40[
```{r patchwork-demo4, eval = FALSE}
library(patchwork)

# make first plot
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(mpg, disp))

# make second plot
p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  aes(gear, disp, group = gear) +
  geom_boxplot()

# place plots on top of one-another #<<
p1 / p2  #<<
```
]

.pull-right.width-40.move-up-3em[
```{r patchwork-demo4-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label="patchwork-demo4", fig.width=3., fig.asp = 2, echo=FALSE, dev = "svg"}
```
]

---

## The **patchwork** package

.tiny-font.pull-left.width-35[
```{r patchwork-demo5, eval = FALSE}
# add a few more plots
p3 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_smooth(aes(disp, qsec))

p4 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_bar(aes(carb))

# make complex arrangement #<<
(p1 | p2 | p3) / p4  #<<
```
]

.pull-right.width-60.move-up-1em[
```{r patchwork-demo5-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label="patchwork-demo5", message = FALSE, fig.width=6., fig.asp = 0.9, echo=FALSE, dev = "svg"}
```
]

## Plot annotations and themes

.tiny-font.pull-left.width-35[
```{r patchwork-demo6, eval = FALSE}
(p1 | p2 | p3) / p4 +
   plot_annotation( #<<
     tag_levels = "A" #<<
   ) #<<
```

## Plot annotations and themes

  theme_minimal_grid()
